title: Ticket #525: RFE: pass all job attribute to VM gahp
description:
Issue:

The starter currently only passes attribute to the vm-gahp if they start with JobVM or VMPARAM, or they are a select set, e.g. ClusterId, ProcId, User, OrigIwd, Args, Arguments, TransferInputFiles, TransferIntermediateFiles.

This limits the attributes that can be taken into account when constructing the VM.

Motivation/Tasks:

It is desirable to provide all attributes to the vm-gahp, especially for libvirt xml construction.

It is also desirable to eliminate the JobVM and VMPARAM prefixes on many attributes, e.g. they are exposed to anyone not using condor_submit to submit a job.
remarks:
2009-May-27 12:57:49 by matt:
Discussed with Jaeyoung...

The reason for only passing a subset of attributes is to speed up vm-gahp startup, e.g. it doesn't have to receive all attributes.

There is a configuration parameter, VM_GAHP_SEND_ALL_CLASSAD (defaults to false), that can control if the JobVM/VMPARAM/etc filter is applied or not.

Direction...

To address the first motivation, VM_GAHP_SEND_ALL_CLASSAD's default could be reversed.

To address the second motivation, the VM_GAHP_SEND_ALL_CLASSAD param can be removed and the JobVM and VMPARAM prefixes can be removed (in a backwards compatible way).

2009-Jul-17 12:07:24 by bkreuter:
Attached a patch to address this issue; the option in condor_config will default to true instead of false.
